item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: Dixit07
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Biography
item.dc:creator: Dixit07
item.content:encoded:
The Beginning of the Ronaldo Biography

Welcome to this in-depth Ronaldo biography

Cristiano Ronaldo¬†born 5 February 1985) is a Portuguese professional footballer¬†who plays as a¬†forward¬†for and¬†captains¬†both the¬†Saudi Pro League¬†club¬†Al Nassr¬†and the¬†Portugal national team. Widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time, Ronaldo has won numerous¬†individual accolades¬†throughout¬†his career, including five¬†Ballon d'Or¬†awards, a record three¬†UEFA Men's Player of the Year Awards, four¬†European Golden Shoes, and was named five times the¬†world's best player¬†by¬†FIFA, all of which are the most by a European player. He has won¬†33 trophies in his career, including seven league titles, five¬†UEFA Champions Leagues, the¬†UEFA European Championship,¬†and the¬†UEFA Nations League. Ronaldo holds the records for most¬†appearances¬†(183),¬†goals¬†(140) and¬†assists¬†(42) in the Champions League,¬†most appearances¬†(30), assists (8) and¬†goals in the European Championship¬†(14), and most¬†international appearances¬†(217) and¬†international goals¬†(135).

2003-2007

On 12 August 2003, less than a week after the friendly that impressed Ferguson, Manchester United signed Ronaldo for ¬£12 million, an England record for a teenager. This also made him the first Portuguese player to sign for the club.

2009‚Äì2015

In 2009, Ronaldo transferred to Real Madrid for a then world record ¬£80 million. At least 80,000 fans attended his presentation at the Santiago Bernab√©u, surpassing the 25-year record of 75,000 fans who had welcomed Diego Maradona at Napoli. Ronaldo said, "This is the completion of my boyhood dream, to be a Real Madrid player.

2015‚Äì2018

Cristiano Ronaldo became Real Madrid's all-time top scorer on 12 September 2015 against Espanyol, netting 230 goals in 203 matches, surpassing the previous record holder, Ra√∫l. Ronaldo also became the all-time top scorer in the Champions League with a hat-trick in the first group match against Shakhtar Donetsk, having finished the previous season level with Messi on 77 goals. Two goals against Malm√∂ FF in a 2‚Äì0 away win on 30 September saw him reach the milestone of 500 career goals for club and country

2018‚Äì2020

On 18 August, Ronaldo made his debut in a 3‚Äì2 away win against Chievo Verona. On 19 September, in his first Champions League match for Juve, he was sent off against Valencia, his first red card in 154 Champions League appearances. In the reverse (home) leg against Valencia, Cristiano won 100 Champions League matches, becoming the first ever player to do so.

Awards

The Ronaldo biography is not just a story of goals and trophies but of determination, sacrifice, and resilience

Major Team Achievements

Portugal (National Team) UEFA Euro 2016 ‚Äì Winner UEFA Nations League 2019 ‚ÄìWinner All-time top scorer for Portugal (120+ international goals) Most international caps for Portugal

Club Achievements

üè¥ Manchester United (2003‚Äì2009, 2021‚Äì2022) Premier League ‚Äì 3√ó (2006‚Äì07, 2007‚Äì08, 2008‚Äì09) FA Cup ‚Äì 1√ó (2003‚Äì04) League Cup ‚Äì 2√ó UEFA Champions League ‚Äì 1√ó (2007‚Äì08) FIFA Club World Cup ‚Äì 1√ó (2008) Community Shield ‚Äì 2√ó

Real Madrid (2009‚Äì2018)

La Liga ‚Äì 2√ó (2011‚Äì12, 2016‚Äì17) Copa del Rey ‚Äì 2√ó Supercopa de Espa√±a ‚Äì 2√ó UEFA Champions League ‚Äì 4√ó (2013‚Äì14, 2015‚Äì16, 2016‚Äì17, 2017‚Äì18) UEFA Super Cup ‚Äì 3√ó FIFA Club World Cup ‚Äì 3√ó

Juventus (2018‚Äì2021)

Serie A ‚Äì 2√ó (2018‚Äì19, 2019‚Äì20) Coppa Italia ‚Äì 1√ó Supercoppa Italiana ‚Äì 2√ó

Al Nassr (2023‚Äìpresent)

While not as decorated in Saudi Arabia yet, he‚Äôs continued to break scoring records, boost the league‚Äôs global profile, and maintain an elite goal-scoring pace.

Individual Achievements

Ballon d‚ÄôOr ‚Äì 5√ó (2008, 2013, 2014, 2016, 2017) FIFA World Player of the Year / The Best ‚Äì Multiple wins and nominations UEFA Best Player in Europe ‚Äì 3√ó European Golden Shoe ‚Äì 4√ó (Most for a European player) UEFA Champions League Top Scorer ‚Äì 7√ó Most Goals in UEFA Champions League History ‚Äì 140+ Most Appearances in UEFA Champions League ‚Äì 180+ Most International Goals in Men's Football ‚Äì 120+ Most Career Goals in Official Matches ‚Äì 850+ goals

Cristiano Ronaldo born 5 February 1985) is a Portuguese professional footballer who plays as a forward for and captains both the Saudi Pro League club Al Nassr and the Portugal national team. Widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time, Ronaldo has won numerous individual accolades throughout his career, including five Ballon d'Or awards, a record three UEFA Men's Player of the Year Awards, four European Golden Shoes, and was named five times the world's best player by FIFA, all of which are the most by a European player. He has won 33 trophies in his career, including seven league titles, five UEFA Champions Leagues, the UEFA European Championship, and the UEFA Nations League. Ronaldo holds the records for most appearances (183), goals (140) and assists (42) in the Champions League, most appearances (30), assists (8) and goals in the European Championship (14), and most international appearances (217) and international goals (135).

Read the full biography of Cristiano Ronaldo from his childhood in Madeira to his record-breaking football career, trophies and global impact

{"timeout":1745057200,"value":{"content":"

The Beginning of the Ronaldo Biography

Welcome to this in-depth Ronaldo biography

[elementor-element data=""]

2003-2007

On 12 August 2003, less than a week after the friendly that impressed Ferguson, Manchester United signed Ronaldo for £12 million, an England record for a teenager. This also made him the first Portuguese player to sign for the club.

2009–2015

In 2009, Ronaldo transferred to Real Madrid for a then world record £80 million. At least 80,000 fans attended his presentation at the Santiago Bernabéu, surpassing the 25-year record of 75,000 fans who had welcomed Diego Maradona at Napoli. Ronaldo said, "This is the completion of my boyhood dream, to be a Real Madrid player.

2015–2018

Cristiano Ronaldo became Real Madrid's all-time top scorer on 12 September 2015 against Espanyol, netting 230 goals in 203 matches, surpassing the previous record holder, Raúl. Ronaldo also became the all-time top scorer in the Champions League with a hat-trick in the first group match against Shakhtar Donetsk, having finished the previous season level with Messi on 77 goals. Two goals against Malmö FF in a 2–0 away win on 30 September saw him reach the milestone of 500 career goals for club and country

2018–2020

On 18 August, Ronaldo made his debut in a 3–2 away win against Chievo Verona. On 19 September, in his first Champions League match for Juve, he was sent off against Valencia, his first red card in 154 Champions League appearances. In the reverse (home) leg against Valencia, Cristiano won 100 Champions League matches, becoming the first ever player to do so.

Awards

[elementor-element data=""]

Major Team Achievements

Portugal (National Team) UEFA Euro 2016 – Winner UEFA Nations League 2019 –Winner All-time top scorer for Portugal (120+ international goals) Most international caps for Portugal

Club Achievements

🏴 Manchester United (2003–2009, 2021–2022) Premier League – 3× (2006–07, 2007–08, 2008–09) FA Cup – 1× (2003–04) League Cup – 2× UEFA Champions League – 1× (2007–08) FIFA Club World Cup – 1× (2008) Community Shield – 2×

Real Madrid (2009–2018)

La Liga – 2× (2011–12, 2016–17) Copa del Rey – 2× Supercopa de España – 2× UEFA Champions League – 4× (2013–14, 2015–16, 2016–17, 2017–18) UEFA Super Cup – 3× FIFA Club World Cup – 3×

Juventus (2018–2021)

Serie A – 2× (2018–19, 2019–20) Coppa Italia – 1× Supercoppa Italiana – 2×

Al Nassr (2023–present)

While not as decorated in Saudi Arabia yet, he’s continued to break scoring records, boost the league’s global profile, and maintain an elite goal-scoring pace.

Individual Achievements

Ballon d’Or – 5× (2008, 2013, 2014, 2016, 2017) FIFA World Player of the Year / The Best – Multiple wins and nominations UEFA Best Player in Europe – 3× European Golden Shoe – 4× (Most for a European player) UEFA Champions League Top Scorer – 7× Most Goals in UEFA Champions League History – 140+ Most Appearances in UEFA Champions League – 180+ Most International Goals in Men's Football – 120+ Most Career Goals in Official Matches – 850+ goals

item.content:encoded:
Cristiano Ronaldo

Greatest Of All Time

Cristiano Ronaldo: A Complete Biography

One of the greatest Football Player

Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro¬†born 5 February 1985) is a Portuguese professional footballer¬†who plays as a¬†forward¬†for and¬†captains¬†both the¬†Saudi Pro League¬†club¬†Al Nassr¬†and the¬†Portugal national team. Widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time, Ronaldo has won numerous¬†individual accolades¬†throughout¬†his career, including five¬†Ballon d'Or¬†awards, a record three¬†UEFA Men's Player of the Year Awards, four¬†European Golden Shoes, and was named five times the¬†world's best player¬†by¬†FIFA, all of which are the most by a European player.

Read More

2002

At age 17, on 14 August 2002, he played his first official match for the first team.

Sporting CP

2003

On 12 August 2003, less than a week after the friendly that impressed Ferguson.

Manchester United

2009

In 2009, Ronaldo transferred to Real Madrid for a then world record ¬£80 million.

Real Madrid

2018

Ronaldo joined Juventus in 2018 for ‚Ç¨100 million, the transfer was the highest ever for a player over 30 years old.

Juventus

2021

On 27 August 2021, Manchester United announced they had reached an agreement with Juventus to re-sign Ronaldo.

Return to Manchester United

2022

On 30 December 2022, Saudi club Al-Nassr reached an agreement for Ronaldo to join the club, signing a contract until 2025.

Al Nassr

Repertoire

Top Achievements of Cristiano Ronaldo in Football

FIFA Ballon d'Or

Ronaldo became United's first Ballon d'Or winner since Best in 1968

Champions League

As the Champions League top scorer, Ronaldo was named the UEFA Club Footballer of the Year

International Career

In 2016, Ronaldo led Portugal to their first-ever trophy at the UEFA Euro 2016.

Awards

Journey to became Greatest of all time

2007-2009

individual success and Ballon d'Or

In the¬†2006‚Äì07 season, he amassed a host of personal awards for the season, winning the¬†Professional Footballers' Association's¬†Player's Player,¬†Fans' Player,¬†Young Player of the Year¬†awards, and the¬†Football Writers' Association's¬†Footballer of the Year award,¬†becoming the first player to win all four main PFA and FWA honours.¬†Ronaldo was named runner-up to¬†Kak√°¬†for the¬†2007 Ballon d'Or,¬†and came third, behind Kak√° and¬†Lionel Messi, in the running for the¬†2007 FIFA World Player of the Year¬†award.

2009-2018

World record transfer and consecutive Ballon d'Or wins

Cristiano Ronaldo had a legendary stint at Real Madrid from 2009 to 2018, winning 4 Champions League titles, 2 La Liga titles, 2 Copa del Rey trophies, 3 UEFA Super Cups, 3 FIFA Club World Cups, and 4 Ballon d'Or awards. He scored 450 goals, becoming the club's all-time top scorer.

2018-2021

Consecutive Serie A titles

Cristiano Ronaldo played for Juventus from 2018 to 2021, winning 2 Serie A titles, 1 Coppa Italia, and 2 Supercoppa Italiana trophies. He scored 101 goals in 134 appearances and became the fastest player to reach 100 goals in Juventus history. Ronaldo also won the Serie A MVP award in 2019.

2021

Cristiano Ronaldo's Return to Manchester United: A Legendary Comeback

Cristiano Ronaldo returned to Manchester United in 2021, scoring 27 goals in 54 appearances. While he didn‚Äôt win any major trophies during this stint, he became the club's top scorer for the 2021-22 season and reached 700 career club goals. Ronaldo left United in late 2022 to join Al Nassr.

2022

Cristiano Ronaldo's Record-Breaking Rise at Al Nassr

Cristiano Ronaldo joined Al Nassr in December 2022, becoming the highest-paid footballer in history. He quickly made an impact, scoring over 50 goals in his first year. Ronaldo helped Al Nassr win the Arab Club Champions Cup in 2023 and continues to break records in the Saudi Pro League.

Upcoming Show

Al-Nassr VS Al Ahli

Al Nassr are¬†next in action on¬†Thursday, February 13¬†when they head to Al Ahli in the Saudi Pro League.

02 / 13

2025

Buy Tickets

2002

At age 17, on 14 August 2002, he played his first official match for the first team.
[elementor-element data=""]

2003

On 12 August 2003, less than a week after the friendly that impressed Ferguson.
[elementor-element data=""]

2009

In 2009, Ronaldo transferred to Real Madrid for a then world record £80 million.
[elementor-element data=""]

2018

Ronaldo joined Juventus in 2018 for €100 million, the transfer was the highest ever for a player over 30 years old.
[elementor-element data=""]

2021

On 27 August 2021, Manchester United announced they had reached an agreement with Juventus to re-sign Ronaldo.
[elementor-element data=""]

2022

On 30 December 2022, Saudi club Al-Nassr reached an agreement for Ronaldo to join the club, signing a contract until 2025.
[elementor-element data=""]

Ronaldo became United's first Ballon d'Or winner since Best in 1968

As the Champions League top scorer, Ronaldo was named the UEFA Club Footballer of the Year

International Career

In 2016, Ronaldo led Portugal to their first-ever trophy at the UEFA Euro 2016.
